message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of sparse signal recovery using the orthogonal matching pursuit (OMP) algorithm, which is a popular method in signal processing and information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.SP (Signal Processing) are the most likely categories. The paper also involves mathematical induction and analysis of the sparsity level of the input vector, which suggests that it could be relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis). Finally, the paper discusses the conditions under which the OMP algorithm can accurately reconstruct a signal, which could be of interest to researchers in cs.SI (Systems and Control).
